Avoid TypeScript errors since the animation properties are now on the motion component Here's a summary of the changes I made: 1. **Fixed Animation Properties**: - Moved `whileHover` and `whileTap` properties from Button components to motion.div wrappers - This resolves the TypeScript error: "Property whileHover does not exist on type" 2. **Improved Code Structure**: - Fixed indentation for better readability - Properly nested the button content within the components - Maintained all the functionality and styling of the buttons 3. **Maintained Animation Effects**: - The buttons will still scale on hover and tap as intended - All other animations and transitions remain functional The Call to Action section now has properly functioning buttons with animations that work without TypeScript errors. He want's something like wordpress, where we have admin panel which help us to modify the page."}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"For adding CMS (Content Management System) capabilities to this Next.js website, I recommend using one of these solutions: 1. **Sanity.io** (Recommended for this case): - Easy to set up - Free for small projects - Great integration with Next.js - User-friendly studio interface - Real-time preview Here's how to implement it: 1. First, install Sanity: ```json { "dependencies": { "@sanity/client": "^6.12.3", "@sanity/image-url": "^1.0.2", "next-sanity": "^7.0.17", // ... other existing dependencies } } ``` 2. Create a new Sanity configuration: ```typescript import { defineConfig } from 'sanity' import { deskTool } from 'sanity/desk' export default defineConfig({ name: 'city-dental-surgery', title: 'City Dental Surgery', projectId: 'your-project-id', dataset: 'production', plugins: [deskTool()], schema: { types: [ { name: 'homePage', title: 'Home Page', type: 'document', fields: [ { name: 'heroTitle', title: 'Hero Title', type: 'string' }, { name: 'heroDescription', title: 'Hero Description', type: 'text' }, { name: 'heroImage', title: 'Hero Image', type: 'image' }, { name: 'services', title: 'Services', type: 'array', of: [{ type: 'object', fields: [ { name: 'title', title: 'Title', type: 'string' }, { name: 'description', title: 'Description', type: 'text' } ] }] } ] } ] } }) ``` 3. Modify your `app/page.tsx` to fetch data from Sanity: ```typescript import { createClient } from 'next-sanity' const client = createClient({ projectId: 'your-project-id', dataset: 'production', apiVersion: '2024-02-21', useCdn: false }) export default async function Home() { const data = await client.fetch(`*[_type == "homePage"][0]`) return (

{data.heroTitle}

{data.heroDescription}

// ... rest of your component
// ... rest of your sections
) } ``` Alternative solutions: 2. **Strapi**: - Self-hosted - More customizable - Requires server setup 3. **ContentLayer**: - File-based CMS - Good for developers - No admin UI 4. **WordPress as Headless CMS**: - Use existing WordPress knowledge - More complex setup - Requires WordPress hosting For your specific case, I recommend Sanity because: 1. Easy setup (can be done in hours) 2. Free tier is generous 3. User-friendly interface 4. No server maintenance required 5. Great image handling 6. Real-time preview 7. Can be hosted on Vercel alongside your Next.js app After implementation, your client will get: 1. Admin panel to modify all content 2. Image upload capability 3. Real-time preview of changes 4. Version history 5. Multiple user accounts if needed Would you like me to provide more detailed implementation steps for any of these solutions? Here's how to fix it: 1. First, go to your Sanity management console at https://www.sanity.io/manage 2. Select your project 3. Go to "API" section 4. Under "CORS Origins", click "Add CORS Origin" 5. Add these URLs: - `http://localhost:3000` (for development) - `http://localhost:5173` (for Sanity Studio development) - Your production domain when you deploy (e.g., `https://yourdomain.com`) For each URL: - Check "Allow credentials" checkbox - Set "Dataset" to "production" (or whatever dataset you're using) Alternatively, you can add CORS configuration to your `sanity.config.ts`: ```typescript import {defineConfig} from 'sanity' import {structureTool} from 'sanity/structure' import {visionTool} from '@sanity/vision' import {schemaTypes} from './schemaTypes' export default defineConfig({ name: 'default', title: 'City-dental', projectId: '7w5qtpys', dataset: 'production', plugins: [structureTool(), visionTool()], schema: { types: schemaTypes, }, cors: { allowOrigins: ['http://localhost:3000'], allowCredentials: true, } }) ``` After making these changes, restart your development server and the CORS error should be resolved. And for searching console as well"}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"# Optimizing Your Website for Google Indexing Here are the key steps to improve your website's Google indexing and search console performance: ## 1. Create a sitemap.xml file ```xml https://yourdomain.com 2023-04-06T15:02:24.021Z weekly 1 https://yourdomain.com/about 2023-04-06T15:02:24.021Z monthly 0.8 ``` For dynamic sitemap generation (recommended): ```typescript import { MetadataRoute } from 'next' import { client } from '@/lib/sanity' export default async function sitemap(): Promise { // Get all pages from Sanity const pages = await client.fetch(`*[_type == "page"]{ slug, _updatedAt }`) const baseUrl = 'https://yourdomain.com' return [ { url: baseUrl, lastModified: new Date(), changeFrequency: 'weekly', priority: 1, }, // Map all your dynamic pages ...pages.map((page: any) => ({ url: `${baseUrl}/${page.slug.current}`, lastModified: new Date(page._updatedAt), changeFrequency: 'monthly' as const, priority: 0.8, })), ] } ``` ## 2. Create a robots.txt file ``` User-Agent: * Allow: / # Disallow admin or private areas if needed # Disallow: /admin/ Sitemap: https://yourdomain.com/sitemap.xml ``` Or using Next.js API: ```typescript import { MetadataRoute } from 'next' export default function robots(): MetadataRoute.Robots { return { rules: { userAgent: '*', allow: '/', // disallow: '/private/', }, sitemap: 'https://yourdomain.com/sitemap.xml', } } ``` ## 3. Improve metadata in layout.tsx ```typescript import './globals.css'; import type { Metadata } from 'next'; import { Inter } from 'next/font/google'; const inter = Inter({ subsets: ['latin'] }); export const metadata: Metadata = { metadataBase: new URL('https://yourdomain.com'), title: { default: 'City Dental Surgery | Îngrijire Dentară Profesională în Cluj-Napoca', template: '%s | City Dental Surgery' }, description: 'Experimentează îngrijirea dentară excepțională la City Dental Surgery în Cluj-Napoca. Facilități moderne, profesioniști cu experiență și tratamente confortabile.', keywords: ['dentist', 'dental surgery', 'Cluj-Napoca', 'dental care', 'stomatologie'], authors: [{ name: 'City Dental Surgery' }], creator: 'City Dental Surgery', publisher: 'City Dental Surgery', formatDetection: { email: false, address: false, telephone: false, }, openGraph: { title: 'City Dental Surgery | Îngrijire Dentară Profesională în Cluj-Napoca', description: 'Experimentează îngrijirea dentară excepțională la City Dental Surgery în Cluj-Napoca.', url: 'https://yourdomain.com', siteName: 'City Dental Surgery', locale: 'ro_RO', type: 'website', images: [ { url: 'https://yourdomain.com/og-image.jpg', width: 1200, height: 630, alt: 'City Dental Surgery', } ], }, icons: { icon: '/favicon.ico', apple: '/apple-touch-icon.png', shortcut: '/favicon.ico', }, manifest: '/site.webmanifest', }; ``` ## 4. Google Search Console Setup 1. Go to [Google Search Console](https://search.google.com/search-console) 2. Add your property (URL prefix or domain) 3. Verify ownership (HTML file, DNS record, or Google Analytics) 4. Submit your sitemap 5. Request indexing for important URLs ## 5. Additional Optimizations 1. **Structured Data**: Add JSON-LD for rich results ```typescript // Add this to your page component export const generateMetadata = async (): Promise { return { other: { 'script:ld+json': JSON.stringify({ '@context': 'https://schema.org', '@type': 'Dentist', name: 'City Dental Surgery', description: 'Professional dental care in Cluj-Napoca', address: { '@type': 'PostalAddress', streetAddress: 'Your Street Address', addressLocality: 'Cluj-Napoca', addressRegion: 'Cluj', postalCode: '400000', addressCountry: 'RO' }, telephone: '+40123456789', url: 'https://yourdomain.com', openingHours: 'Mo-Fr 09:00-18:00', priceRange: '$$' }) } } } ``` 2. **Performance Optimization**: Ensure your site loads quickly - Optimize images - Use Next.js Image component - Implement proper caching 3. **Mobile Friendliness**: Ensure your site is responsive 4. **Secure with HTTPS**: Make sure your site uses HTTPS 5. **Internal Linking**: Create a logical structure with internal links These steps will significantly improve your website's indexing in Google and provide better data in Search Console for monitoring performance. Create a sitemap.xml file ````xml path=app/sitemap.xml mode=EDIT https://yourdomain.com 2023-04-06T15:02:24.021Z weekly 1 https://yourdomain.com/about 2023-04-06T15:02:24.021Z monthly 0.8 ```` For dynamic sitemap generation (recommended): ````typescript path=app/sitemap.ts mode=EDIT import { MetadataRoute } from 'next' import { client } from '@/lib/sanity' export default async function sitemap(): Promise { // Get all pages from Sanity const pages = await client.fetch(`*[_type == "page"]{ slug, _updatedAt }`) const baseUrl = 'https://yourdomain.com' return [ { url: baseUrl, lastModified: new Date(), changeFrequency: 'weekly', priority: 1, }, // Map all your dynamic pages ...pages.map((page: any) => ({ url: `${baseUrl}/${page.slug.current}`, lastModified: new Date(page._updatedAt), changeFrequency: 'monthly' as const, priority: 0.8, })), ] } ```` ## 2. Create a robots.txt file ```` path=app/robots.txt mode=EDIT User-Agent: * Allow: / # Disallow admin or private areas if needed # Disallow: /admin/ Sitemap: https://yourdomain.com/sitemap.xml ```` Or using Next.js API: ````typescript path=app/robots.ts mode=EDIT import { MetadataRoute } from 'next' export default function robots(): MetadataRoute.Robots { return { rules: { userAgent: '*', allow: '/', // disallow: '/private/', }, sitemap: 'https://yourdomain.com/sitemap.xml', } } ```` ## 3. Improve metadata in layout.tsx ````typescript path=app/layout.tsx mode=EDIT import './globals.css'; import type { Metadata } from 'next'; import { Inter } from 'next/font/google'; const inter = Inter({ subsets: ['latin'] }); export const metadata: Metadata = { metadataBase: new URL('https://yourdomain.com'), title: { default: 'City Dental Surgery | Îngrijire Dentară Profesională în Cluj-Napoca', template: '%s | City Dental Surgery' }, description: 'Experimentează îngrijirea dentară excepțională la City Dental Surgery în Cluj-Napoca. Facilități moderne, profesioniști cu experiență și tratamente confortabile.', keywords: ['dentist', 'dental surgery', 'Cluj-Napoca', 'dental care', 'stomatologie'], authors: [{ name: 'City Dental Surgery' }], creator: 'City Dental Surgery', publisher: 'City Dental Surgery', formatDetection: { email: false, address: false, telephone: false, }, openGraph: { title: 'City Dental Surgery | Îngrijire Dentară Profesională în Cluj-Napoca', description: 'Experimentează îngrijirea dentară excepțională la City Dental Surgery în Cluj-Napoca.', url: 'https://yourdomain.com', siteName: 'City Dental Surgery', locale: 'ro_RO', type: 'website', images: [ { url: 'https://yourdomain.com/og-image.jpg', width: 1200, height: 630, alt: 'City Dental Surgery', } ], }, icons: { icon: '/favicon.ico', apple: '/apple-touch-icon.png', shortcut: '/favicon.ico', }, manifest: '/site.webmanifest', }; ```` ## 4. Google Search Console Setup 1. Go to [Google Search Console](https://search.google.com/search-console) 2. Add your property (URL prefix or domain) 3. Verify ownership (HTML file, DNS record, or Google Analytics) 4. Submit your sitemap 5. Request indexing for important URLs ## 5. Additional Optimizations 1. **Structured Data**: Add JSON-LD for rich results ````typescript path=app/page.tsx mode=EDIT // Add this to your page component export const generateMetadata = async (): Promise { return { other: { 'script:ld+json': JSON.stringify({ '@context': 'https://schema.org', '@type': 'Dentist', name: 'City Dental Surgery', description: 'Professional dental care in Cluj-Napoca', address: { '@type': 'PostalAddress', streetAddress: 'Your Street Address', addressLocality: 'Cluj-Napoca', addressRegion: 'Cluj', postalCode: '400000', addressCountry: 'RO' }, telephone: '+40123456789', url: 'https://yourdomain.com', openingHours: 'Mo-Fr 09:00-18:00', priceRange: '$$' }) } } } ```` 2. **Performance Optimization**: Ensure your site loads quickly - Optimize images - Use Next.js Image component - Implement proper caching 3. **Mobile Friendliness**: Ensure your site is responsive 4. **Secure with HTTPS**: Make sure your site uses HTTPS 5. **Internal Linking**: Create a logical structure with internal links These steps will significantly improve your website's indexing in Google and provide better data in Search Console for monitoring performance. If I write: ``` {heroSection?.countOfPatients ?? '200'} ``` In this case I'll always get '200', event if heroSection?.countOfPatients has info"}},{"id":2,"type":4,"ide_state_node":{"workspaceFolders":[{"repositoryRoot":"/Users/maxrozh/projects/city-dental-surgey","folderRoot":"/Users/maxrozh/projects/city-dental-surgey"}],"workspaceFoldersUnchanged":false,"currentTerminal":{"terminalId":2,"currentWorkingDirectory":"/Users/maxrozh/projects/city-dental-surgey"}}}],"response_text":"The error you're encountering is related to React's rendering process. This type of error typically occurs when React tries to update the DOM but encounters an inconsistency in the component tree structure. The issue with `{heroSection?.countOfPatients ?? ''}` is that when `heroSection` is initially `null` (before the data is loaded), it renders an empty string. Then when the data loads, React tries to update that node, but something in the DOM structure has changed. Let's fix this by ensuring consistent rendering. Here are a few approaches: ### Option 1: Use a consistent fallback value ```jsx {heroSection?.countOfPatients || '120+'} ``` This will show '120+' until the real data loads, then switch to the actual value. ### Option 2: Use conditional rendering with a placeholder of the same type ```jsx {typeof heroSection?.countOfPatients === 'number' ? heroSection.countOfPatients : '120+'} ``` ### Option 3: Add a loading state Since we already have an `isLoading` state in your component, you can use it: ```jsx {isLoading ? '120+' : (heroSection?.countOfPatients || '120+')} ``` ### Option 4: Ensure the DOM structure is consistent The most robust solution is to ensure the DOM structure remains consistent regardless of whether data is loaded: ```jsx {heroSection?.countOfPatients || '120+'} ``` This ensures that the same DOM element type is always rendered, which helps React maintain the component tree correctly. I recommend using Option 4 as it's the most reliable approach. Make sure that the DOM structure around this value doesn't change between the initial render and when the data loads. You can now add your custom content through the Sanity Studio using the updated schema. The text will support line breaks, so you can format the lists of problems and solutions with each item on a new line for better readability. Here's what I did: 1. **Added proper type annotations**: - Added explicit type annotations for the category objects: `{name: string, services?: any[]}` - This tells TypeScript that the categories have a `services` property 2. **Added services property to default categories**: - Updated the default categories to include an empty services array - This ensures the type is consistent even with the fallback data 3. **Used a safer approach to access the active category**: - Created an Immediately Invoked Function Expression (IIFE) to safely get the active category - Renamed the variable to avoid name conflicts with the state variable - Properly cast the type to ensure TypeScript knows the structure 4. **Fixed the closing of the IIFE**: - Added proper closing syntax for the IIFE to ensure the code is valid These changes ensure that TypeScript understands the structure of your data and won't throw type errors. The price list section should now work correctly with any number of categories, and the TypeScript error should be resolved. The key issue was that TypeScript didn't know that the objects in your categories array had a `services` property. By adding explicit type annotations and ensuring consistent data structures, we've fixed this issue.
